meanings.definition: The state or fact of being different or distinct from one another.
meanings.sent1: In a group of friends, the nonidentities of each person make them unique.
meanings.sent2: The nonidentities between the two paintings were evident in their color schemes.
meanings.sent3: The nonidentities of the twin brothers often led to funny mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: The nonidentities of the two political parties became more pronounced during the election.
meanings.sent5: The nonidentities of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to find the right fit.

meanings.definition: A lack of similarity or correspondence between two things.
meanings.sent1: There was a clear nonidentities between the old and new versions of the software.
meanings.sent2: The nonidentities in their opinions caused frequent disagreements.
meanings.sent3: The nonidentities in their tastes for ice cream flavors always led to funny arguments.
meanings.sent4: The nonidentities in their handwriting styles made it easy to tell who wrote each note.
meanings.sent5: The nonidentities in their fashion choices made for an interesting contrast.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of not being identical.
meanings.sent1: The nonidentities of the fingerprints helped solve the crime.
meanings.sent2: The nonidentities in their voices made it easy to distinguish between the twins.
meanings.sent3: The nonidentities in their dance moves added a fun element to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The nonidentities in their personalities created a dynamic and engaging group dynamic.
meanings.sent5: The nonidentities in their DNA profiles confirmed they were not related.
